TG/DTG/DTA is a useful thermo-analytical technique to investigate the mass loss of a sample as a function of time or temperature. The decomposition temperature corresponding to the maximum slopes of each mass-loss stage recorded on the ThermoGravimetric curve is seen as a peak when the Derivative ThermoGravimetric (DTG) curve is plotted
17 . This technique was used to characterize the thermal stability of some essential oils, i.e. orange, lemongrass, and basil oil
15 , as well as to evaluate the activation energy for the evaporation of lavender, cypress, tea tree, clove, eucalyptus, etc. oils
13, 16 .
